page.title: 16Events north: FINTRY
page.content:
Since the early 1970's a village fete has been organised by the Parent Teachers Association at the Primary School. The proceeds are used to purchase items of equipment for the school.
The fete - called the{Fintry Fling}- is a major social event. Most village organisations run stalls for the PTA and themselves. It features sporting events such as football, the highlight being the annual{Dunmore Hill Race. This has a very respectable record of 16 mins 23 secs. Just look at it on the map and count the contours!
Not quite as energetic but equally popular is the annual{Fun Run}- a five mile circuit ending at the sports club. This is tackled by old and young weans and dugs - all enthusiasts.
